title: 109_hr2517
content: INDEXATION OF DEFERRED ANNUITIES. Amendments to Section 8338 of title 5, United States Code, allow for the computation of annuities based on average pay adjustments in the General Schedule rates. Amendments to Section 8338 of title 5, United States Code, allow for the computation of annuities based on average pay adjustments in the General Schedule rates. Average pay for survivor annuities shall be increased based on the commencement date, not exceeding the highest rate of pay earned by the employee or Member. Amendments to Section 8415 of title 5, United States Code, specify that the average pay used in computing deferred annuities shall be the average pay described in section 8401(3), increased by percentage adjustments in General Schedule rates of pay. The average pay used in computing survivor annuities for former employees or Members shall be increased based on the commencement date of the annuity. Average pay cannot exceed the rate of basic pay earned at the time of the highest pay rate. Amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System Act of 1986 regarding the computation of deferred annuities and the determination of average pay for such purposes. Amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System Act of 1986 include changes to the computation of survivor annuities based on the service of a former employee or Member who dies in specific circumstances. The computation of the annuity under paragraph (5) is outlined for determining the amount of a survivor annuity under chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code. Amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System Act of 1986 involve changes in computing survivor annuities for former employees or Members who pass away. Sections of title 5, United States Code, are amended to include former employees or Members in the calculation of annuities. Amendment to provide survivor annuity eligibility for the widow or widower of a deferred annuitant who dies before establishing a valid claim for annuity under CSRS, similar to FERS. Amendment to section 8341 of title 5, United States Code, allows the widow or widower of a deferred annuitant who dies before claiming annuity to receive 55 percent of the annuity or a lump-sum credit. The amendment allows the widow or widower of a former employee to receive an annuity, capped at the difference between their potential annuity and any survivor annuity payable to a former spouse. The amendment allows the widow or widower of a former employee to receive an annuity, capped at the difference between their potential annuity and any survivor annuity payable to a former spouse. SEC. 3. EFFECTIVE DATES. The amendments made by section 1 apply to annuities or survivor annuities starting before, on, or after the enactment date. Recomputations are allowed for individuals entitled to annuities based on pre-Act service, with a 12-month window for application after OPM regulations. The amendment made by section 2 of the Act applies to annuities or survivor annuities starting on or after the enactment date. Recomputations under the amendment shall only be effective for amounts accruing for months after the enactment date. The lump-sum credit has been voided. The right to a survivor annuity is preserved for individuals eligible before the enactment of this Act. Definitions for "widow," "widower," and "lump-sum credit" are provided.
